alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:56PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Henry and northwestern Clay Counties through 545 PM EDT/445 PM CDT/... At 456 PM EDT/356 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Gaines, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Days Crossroads, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Standleys Store, Otho, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Moores Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan, Garnersville, Screamer, Coates, Bagby State Park, Thomas Mill Creek, Lawrenceville and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
